text:
I tried building 2.0.44 on Win2K from the tarball distribution, but Makefile.win complains 
about some missing iconv component.  The zip distro builds ok, but VC6 lists around 50 warnings.  
Are these warnings normal?

I was able to compile 2.0.43 from the tar.gz without any problems.  
I really don't understand why there is separate zip win32 source.  There should be one unified 
source release.  The zip file is nearly twice as big as the tarball :(

I apologize if this is the 
wrong place to report this, but it appears to me as some sort of problem with the 2.0.44 source 
release.
creator: ksadeq@hotmail.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Perhaps we distributed a seperate .zip because;

    1) MSVC doesn't recognize Unix 'text' for .dsp/.dsw files?

    2) We no longer keep .mak files for MSVC projects,
       and generate them on-the-fly at release time?

    3) The very errors you encountered, that iconv isn't needed
       on Unix but isn't available on the typical win32 box?

  Perhaps we don't want to waste the bandwidth on those very large
  (as you noted) iconv sources?
